website_summaries.verdict: Gives you one of the best values in bubble wrap with a lower price per square foot.
pros: Available in rolls between 5' and 175' in length, so you can pick just the right size
Uses a 3/16" height in the bubbles so the product has plenty of cushioning and thickness
Has perforations every 12" along the roll for convenience
cons: Bubbles may pop too easily when placed under stress

customer_reviews.title: The best around!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll never try an off brand again. I recently tried a well reviewed off brand on Amazon. It was awful. I’ll never do it again. The duck perforation rips easier. The bubbles are thicker and offer more protection, equals less wrapping needed. Objects wrapped in the spell grab slide easily into bubble mailers too. I was surprised to see my 150 foot roll is actually larger than the 175 foot roll of the offbrand because the bubbles on the offbrand are so thin. This truly is the best bubble wrap on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Elle-Jay

customer_reviews.title: All I Wamt to Do is Pop Bubbles
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I use bubble wrap for shipping my art work, and this works like bubble wrap is supposed to work. I truly have to control the urge to sit with the entire roll and proceed to popping. Hey people - it is bubble wrap. Although, it seems weird to write a review about bubble wrap, if you notice, there are brands where all of the bubbles are not fully inflated. Every bubble in this wrap seem to have full inflated qualities which makes it harder to not just start popping. Just wanted to have a little fun with this review. It is bubble wrap, with full bubbles and it works. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxsology

customer_reviews.title: Quality decreases while price increases...
customer_reviews.text: This roll seems half inflated and bubbles pop almost without any pressure at all. The wrap may say Duck but the quality has decreased while price increases. Disappointed in product -wish we could "flag" a seller so i remember not to support again. They get'cha knowing to return only adds to total out-of-pocket and one must purchase same/similar product adding greater expense and more time.
customer_reviews.author: MTEK

customer_reviews.title: Great insulator
customer_reviews.text: Well i didnt use the product to use a packing . I used it to insulate my sauna windows. My sauna works great the majority of the year. However this winter has been cooler. So i used the product to insulate the windows.
customer_reviews.author: grinder

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t appear to be original!
customer_reviews.text: Wow......just opened the roll and lost over a foot of wrap with the Duck sticker....I have been wrapping for a move for a few weeks now. I know good bubble wrap. This can’t be an original Duck brand wrap. The bubbles pop while wrapping items loosely. Please don’t waste your money. I am stuck with the roll and out over $13. I will have to use as a filler I suppose because I sure can’t wrap anything fragile in this stuff. I would gladly return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Lois D.

customer_reviews.title: Very small amount of bubble wrap
customer_reviews.text: Smallest roll of bubble wrap ever. This shouldn’t cost more than $6, I can wrap 1 item with this.
customer_reviews.author: ap

customer_reviews.title: Keep things safe! Great
customer_reviews.text: I have collectibles that need to be safe. Believe it or not there are quality issues with soem brands. There’s always soem cheapskate that cuts corners at your expense to make a dime. Not so here this is good quality for the price and amount!
customer_reviews.author: Mark DeVoe

customer_reviews.title: Many deflated bubbles
customer_reviews.text: Why are there so many deflated / popped bubbles?? I can't help but feel like this is not from the real Duck's brand. I bought one last year when I put it side by side, the look and feel are completely different. I felt compelled to write a review because there are SO many holes / deflated bubbles. Totally not worth the purchase. At every tear, there are the two lines worth of bubbles are deflated on top of random ones within the sheet itself. I honestly feel completely robbed by this purchase. Very unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to handle if you are of our older generation.
customer_reviews.text: First, this showed up in my buy again list. This is not what I bought before. My earlier purchase had Six rolls this is one gigantic roll. I do not appreciate the substitution. The large roll is difficult to maneuver. I do like the product itself but in the smaller rolls
customer_reviews.author: wilda foster

customer_reviews.title: Used for window insulation
customer_reviews.text: Item came quickly and packaged well. This time of year I was looking for a way to keep my house warm and keep the cold out. I checked YouTube for ideas. You just wet the window and the bubble wrap and press the bubble wrap onto the window ( bubble side to window) it holds like magic. And YES I could definitely feel the difference. My house is warmer. Wish I knew about this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: SHARON E

customer_reviews.title: Bubble wrap that suits my needs
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I think this is a good quality and abundant amount of bubble wrap. I was pleasantly surprised to see how well and intact it arrived during shipping. Overall, I am happy with my purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: V. C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy tear off bubble wrap at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Easy tear off bubble wrap at a great price. Made the mistake of buying some at UPS store and it was about the same price for a very small amount. Glad I could find it on Amazon for a better price as I needed lots of it for a move.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperMJ

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: For the money spent I was really shocked at the sheer size of the roll. It's a huge roll! I've used it thrice since purchasing to ship items and it does the job. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: CEO CIN

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The item was packaged well. Very easy to use since it’s a well known product. Very good price for the money and good for packaging collectibles.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna H.

customer_reviews.title: I used this to insulate my windows to lower my ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to insulate my windows to lower my a.c. bill here in Las Vegas. You simply cut to size and spray water on the window with a spray bottle and put the flat side to the window and it sticks. I used 2 rolls for a 2 story 2500sq ft home(5 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, 3 living rooms and 2 dining rooms) I am going to purchase a 3rd roll, 2 rolls did all but 4 windows. Immediately you can feel the temperature significantly drop. I am a renter so this is an affordable way to insulate windows instead of pricey solar screens or films on a home I don't own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Fragile
customer_reviews.text: This needs to be wrapped to keep the bubbles from popping while you are trying to wrap with it, try pulling it off roll, pop pop, pop,. 2 thumbs down I won't buy it again . If I hadn't been in a bind I would of returned it .
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Bubbles pop easily and come deflated, and the thin plastic tears.
customer_reviews.text: The bubbles popped way too easily while I was wrapping my fragile items. A bunch of the bubbles seemed to have deflated before the roll ever reached me. And the plastic backing is so thin that when I tried to remove a piece of masking tape, it tore wide open. I much preferred working with the thin foam from Home Depot. I definitely won’t be buying this cheap crap again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B

customer_reviews.title: Too thin.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected at all. I've been using this brand from Walmart that's amazing, but I needed a longer roll. I would go through them in a couple days for my business where I ship a lot of glass bottles. So, I searched Amazon and found this bubble wrap had pretty good reviews and good price. I regret it. I have to wrap the bottles multiple times and it's still so thin. I'm going back to the one from Walmart and just going to spend more on extra. Way more worth it than this stuff. Very frustrated and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ebby Elsebai

customer_reviews.title: Very tricky
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy 12 in. x 175 ft. but 12 in. x 180 ft. was sold at a cheaper price (now it's the same price) so decided to buy the longer one. I thought 180 was cheaper because it is divided in 4 rolls which could be inconvenient in some cases. Wrong. The durability is totally different. 175 is thicker and more durable. 180 is very thin, soft and easily gets torn.
customer_reviews.author: TKTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for my move
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly functional. Just moved apartments and none of my glasses or bowls (wrapped in this bubble wrap!) broke, which is all I ask for! Would re-purchase for a future move.
customer_reviews.author: Bilbeit

customer_reviews.title: How To Work The Perforations Is The Trick To Liking It
customer_reviews.text: It took a minute to figure out how to find and work the perforations but if you lift the bubble wrap up you can kind of see where they are. If you can't they're every 12 inches. Then you have to pull hard to tear at the perforations. I also run my fingers on the back side of the wrap and if it pops through, there is the next perforations. I like this bubble wrap. I think it works well and the box is the perfect size. Not huge.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great bubble wrap... Used it to insulate some single pane windows throughout the house and it worked perfectly. Did most of the house for the same cost of buying a single 3M window kit. Although you can't see out clearly, the light seems to be much brighter as the bubble magnifies it. Reminds me how bright it is after a few inches of snow
customer_reviews.author: Grandma in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Not Destroyed Like Store Bubble Wrap
customer_reviews.text: I get it, everyone loves to pop bubble wrap. I got my first Duck Bubble Wrap from Walmart. I lost at least 36 inches because of sticker damage. I lost other sheets because of people popping bubbles. I wanted to order it this time. This came PERFECTLY. The sticker left zero damage to the sheets of bubble wrap below it. Because it was shipped every bubble was unpopped. This bubble wrap is so easy to separate into 12 inch sheets. When you ship out as many customer packages as I do, you need a decent bubble wrap. I'll continue buying from this supplier.
customer_reviews.author: h-dj

customer_reviews.title: There was a lot of bubbles
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about this bubble wrap: it was original, it was on a roll, it was cushioning, it was perforated every 12", and it was good to wrap stuff in. I've attached a picture of the bubble wrap for reference. It's inside the box.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of Dragons

customer_reviews.title: FRUSTRATION
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several brands of bubble wrap from Amazon with each time thinking this roll of bubble wrap will be easier to use than the last ordered. The customer review ratings do not give a clear picture. In my opinion they are over rated. Both my employees and I have found it frustrating when customers who are waiting a minute seems to them like an eternity. These rolls DO NOT tear apart along perforations . 85% of the the time one must stretch the plastic to the deformed image of an Hour Glass until it rips. I thought the "Duck" brand would make the difference. It does not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the bubbles pop much too easily. We are moving right now and I wrapped ...
customer_reviews.text: Interesting reviews here praising the bubble wrap! In my experience with this product, the bubbles pop much too easily. We are moving right now and I wrapped some of our dishes. When lifting a bubble-wrapped dish or what have you, the bubbles pop! No matter how light I grab something, I’m still popping bubbles very easily. Because of this I must wrap more layers than I want and running out of the wrap more quickly. The one pro is the perforations that make it easy to separate them. Ultimately, I would NOT recommend this bubble wrap and would advise looking at another brand. This bubble wrap had one job! 🤷🏻‍♂️ 👎🏽
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: High quality bubble wrap
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pack of these for packing my ebay sales and it works great. The bubbles are all filled and it's perforated at intervals for easy tearing. The plastic feels nice in the hand and provides decent protection for whatever object you're wrapping.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian T.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than local stores and comes with a free box!
customer_reviews.text: It was much cheaper to buy this on Amazon versus home depot. I bought the 150 sq ft for the same price as ~50 sq ft locally and it arrived one day later. The best part I never considered was that it came with a free medium sized box! It's a tiny bit smaller than the home depot medium sized and no where near as sturdy, but it's useful nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all your shipping dreams!
customer_reviews.text: I ship Funko Pops as a pretty regular hobby of mine, and I trust this stuff to get the job done. Safely protects whatever you are trying to ship, It also tears evenly by hand, which is so nice. You won't have to go searching for scissors, or tearing unevenly. It tears in clean straight lines. I have no complaints with this bubble wrap. Pros: -Tears easily and evenly and by hand -Great protection for shipping fragile products -Great price Cons: -none
customer_reviews.author: Luke Marrs

customer_reviews.title: just crap! tried to tear label off and it tore ...
customer_reviews.text: cheesy product... just crap! tried to tear label off and it tore bubble wrap also...tried to tear at perforations and just tore randomly...very thin and not at all worth the money
customer_reviews.author: barbara lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great bubble wrap for the price
customer_reviews.text: Needed this to use in packing and protecting some breakables and had no issue. It was the right amount of bubble wrap and kept them protected on my long drive. This is my second time purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as others
customer_reviews.text: I got this product as I needed bubble wrap quickly and another vendor's bubble wrap that I had used prior was not in stock. This product was inferior to the other product. The weight of the plastic was significantly lighter weight (think much lighter than grocery bags). The net result is the bubble's are way less stable and break much easier. The other product from Westpack was a superior product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Chill

customer_reviews.title: Great for Practical Jokes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to bubble wrap my coworker's cubicle while he was at training (love our military). He loved it. We did such a good job!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: FAKE BUBBLE WRAP
customer_reviews.text: This was not Duck Brand Bubble Wrap. It was cheap off brand with the duck bubble wrap sticker. I use both frequently and can tell the difference. It was poor quality. No perforation. This was not the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Original Bubbles means Tiny Little Bubbles
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that this bubble wrap consisted of tiny, small bubbles for small delicate items like jewelry, etc. This is NOT a roll of (what I consider to be) the standard 1/2” size bubbles that are commonplace everywhere. Tiny Bubbles. Unfortunately I can’t use this. It would cost me as much (as I paid for them) to return to Amazon. So ...... I’m disappointed in this purchase. Live & Learn (I guess)
customer_reviews.author: bvision

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Kinda thin for my liking but as long as I use one sheet per item it'll be fine. I make wands with crystals so I'm just making sure the crystals don't get damaged in the process of delivery. These sheets are automatically easy to rip off so one sheet per wand does just fine.
customer_reviews.author: classy1302

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and just get a better quality. This was flimsy and already half deflated when it got to me. Had to wrap items several times to get the protection of one layer of the bubble wrap i pick up at the post office.
customer_reviews.author: cheeeza

customer_reviews.title: Just terrible
customer_reviews.text: Probably the worst bubble wrap that I have ever had the misfortune of buying. Its very cheaply made, half of the bubbles do not even have air in them and you have to use twice as much as any other bubble wrap that I have used to get the same protection. Plus, you can't remotely see what's in the bubble wrap once it's wrapped because the material is so cloudy and dark. Im returning this horrible product!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie06291989

customer_reviews.title: Thicker than the ones we've used before
customer_reviews.text: This is great is you're just trying to throw in bubble wrap to prevent something from breaking. It's thick plastic and the bubbles are thick. We bought a thinner version before and it was great to wrap items tightly for shipping. This one made it a little harder to wrap and also took up more space in our box when shipping out items.. Because it was so bulky, it was also hard to stack the items to pack and then it was like anti-slip or something because it was so hard to slide the items to reposition them. So great product if you're really just trying to protect stuff and not wrap items.
customer_reviews.author: Izzie

customer_reviews.title: Performs As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I use this every time I need to pack for moving. Excellent product, I've never had an issue with all the times that I've ordered and used this.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: It's far too thin and the bubbles break with a light touch.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why others say this is good bubble wrap- It appears to be made of cheap recycled plastic, which I don't mind at all but the plastic is so thin that you can't prevent the bubbles from popping any time you touch it. Because the bubbles break so easily, I had to use so much more bubble wrap to get adequate protection. Next time I'll spend a little more for a better quality wrap and save money from not having to use so much of it.
customer_reviews.author: James Powell

customer_reviews.title: Very Thin and Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: expected this to be a little more heavier than most but very light and thin bubble wrap. You get less too only 150 feet instead of usual 175 feet so you expect it to be of better quality. It's OK but still have to use more for cushioning than planned. The brand name is one reason for purchase but the quality is just not there. Normally I purchase this product through a local outlet store which carries 3M and is a few dollars more but I find it is much superior. So back to the local store.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to wrap breakable items
customer_reviews.text: Due to moving, we needed a lot of bubble wrap for all of our breakable glassware, picture frames, etc. I did a lot of research and this kind seemed to be the best value for the amount of bubble wrap. When we received it, I was surprised at how sturdy it was. It is not the cheap bubble wrap you sometimes find. This worked great for all the items in our house!
customer_reviews.author: T.Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Duck Brand = High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Never really thought about the quality of bubble wrap before, but it's actually important because the bubbles on low quality, cheap bubble wrap pop easier, making it more likely that your items will be damaged. This is good bubble wrap. Used it in a move and didn't have anything break. And the individual packages were more convenient than having one giant roll.
customer_reviews.author: Cascade book lover

customer_reviews.title: Great for Winter Window Insulation!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for winter window insulation (spray water on glass, cut bubble wrap to fit, and put it bubble side toward glass on your windows, then seal with window plastic - the "blow-dryer type"). It was also much cheaper and higher quality than that offered at the shipping store!
customer_reviews.author: Cecmc

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were possible to buy good bubble wrap with small bubbles at a reasonable price. We are using a LOT of bubble wrap and it just gets so expensive. I buy this because it is a name brand and the reviews were decent. All the stuff that is cheap gets poor reviews. I have purchased a lot of this and will probably purchased a lot more. Have not visited the big box stores to see what is available.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: Great bubble wrap from reliable company for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the perforation which allowed for easy separation of the bubble wrap making wrapping my products that much faster. The bubble protection provided by the wrap seemed to work well, and the price was good for the amount of wrap that you get.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Smart

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy again. Wal matt dame brand  is better quality, quantity, and ease of performance
customer_reviews.text: This was not as good as quality of the same advertised size and brand at the local Walmart, which with my arthritic hands and moving in a quick time frame- I needed to feel perforations. This online brand was different. Ripping in shreds, could not rip in perforations easily, bubbles not as puffy. Won’t but again
customer_reviews.author: Shell

customer_reviews.title: Quality Duck branded light duty bubble wrap with perforated tear sections every foot
customer_reviews.text: Good quality lite bubble wrap from a trusted brand in Duck. Perfect for my needs of wrapping China tea cups before placing in their storage case. I especially like the perforated tear sections every foot as it makes minimizing wasteful use. Just be aware that this particular bubble wrap isn't overly thick at all, but the bubbles arrived in tact for intended use. I would 💯% recommend this product for purchase and if I ever run out I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product, but not for all uses.
customer_reviews.text: It worked for packing, but the bubbles were too small for what I was trying to cushion - dishes, glasses, crystal. Also, the narrow width (12 inches) required using more to wrap larger items because it meant double coverage wrapping length and width. The 12" perforations are handy but sometimes hard to find. Once you find them, they tear cleanly and easily. I should have ordered the larger bubble size, and perhaps a wider roll. It is a good product, one that I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This bubble wraps works fine. As other reviews state, you don’t get all that much for your money, and the bubbles are a bit small. That being said, it works great for small value items and will definitely still keep things safe. It was hard to tear off pieces using the perforated edges though...I resorted to just using scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No better than brands half the price
customer_reviews.text: The decline in Duck Brand quality is astounding. A roll that used to last me 2-3 weeks is now used up in less than a week, because I have to use 2-3 times as much wrap to achieve the same level of protection. The sheets at the start of the roll are of mediocre quality, and by the time you get 2/3 in, the wrap is laughably thin. The only thing that works consistently is the perforations (which are often problematic with cheaper brands), but otherwise there is no reason to continue using what used to be a great brand.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: This bubble wrap worked great. There’s perforations so it’s easy to separate and it was great for packing all of my decor and small delicate things. The thickness id say was a small or medium but it worked great for what I used it for. And I still have maybe less than half the roll left after I packed my small 2 bedroom house. Only used it for decor and some kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Jacy

customer_reviews.title: Five stars!
customer_reviews.text: Somehow even larger than I expected, which is totally a good thing! Otherwise it came exactly as expected and has been working well for me with packaging things to ship and fragile things that I need to store away. It's sort of difficult to see where the pieces tear off but you figure it out. I also don't think all the pieces are actually the same size, but it doesn't bother me. I really have no complaints and this is working out great. I don't see myself running out anytime soon, but when I do I will definitely be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Aundra-LynTop Contributor: Cross-Stitch

customer_reviews.title: Price rip-off
customer_reviews.text: I am only going to keep this purchase because i need bubble wrap at the moment. However, this amount is not nearly as large as it appears, according to the description, and it's certainly not worth this price. I advise others to look for a better deal elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: mbrown877

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is great bubble wrap. I've purchased slightly cheaper bubble wrap before trying to save some money, but the perforations were so poor I ended up having to use a knife to cut the bubble wrap which is a giant pain when you're trying to get things packed up in a timely manner. This bubble wrap is perforated perfectly and does the job. The price is also comparable to other bubble wraps offered on Amazon so I would suggest not trying to save a couple dollars if you find something cheaper, because it will also be a cheaper quality product. Stick with Duck brand and you shouldn't have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hesse

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 175' role of bubble cushioning in order to safely wrap our 70-piece wedding china that we are passing on to our daughter. The perforated seams tore apart perfectly and with ease. I would purchase again from Duck Brand for future needs.
customer_reviews.author: Frito

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Was persuaded to buy name brand bubble wrap after reading some reviews of poor quality with the lower priced knockoffs. The Duck Brand was worth the additional cost, and it wasn't really that expensive to begin with! The bubbles and the sheets were all uniform, no flattened sections as reported with the lower quality products, and the perforations made it pretty easy to "size" the wrap as you were working. Overall, very high quality product that worked as advertised and met all expectations.
customer_reviews.author: PattyC

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This bubble wrap is QUALITY! This, ladies and gentlemen is the good stuff - the brand name Bubble Wrap. Is it a little more expensive than the generics? Yes. But, you are guaranteed to get a good, quality product, and not deal with the doubt of a flimsy generic arriving at your doorstep. The only reason this one doesn't get five stars is because, let's face it, it is a bit pricey for a bunch of plastic - but it works great, and has protected multitudes of my own personal and business packages being sent around the country and the world without damage.
customer_reviews.author: The Craftsman

customer_reviews.title: Strong Tape
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted and aimed on buying. Although the picture did make the bubbles look bigger, it wasn't needed for my deliveries. Plus, the tape on the bubble wrap was very annoying. It stuck onto the bubble wrap over the majority of the product and was extremely hard to remove the tape without damaging the bubbles or leaving some tape behind.
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain. It'd be funny if it was shipped in a box filled with more plastic wrap (yippee, free plastic wrap!) But it came in a box of itself. They put boxes in boxes, why not plastic wrap around plastic wrap in boxes? Haha Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fast to wrap and pack
customer_reviews.text: Deducted one star for presentation only because when you go to unfurl the roll, if you aren't careful... It's very easy to accidentally rip the bubble wrap because of the huge product information sticker that's slapped on. Ultimately it didn't affect my overall opinion of the product! The tearable sections were great and saved me A LOT of time.
customer_reviews.author: Ali O

customer_reviews.title: Must have Bubble Wrap
customer_reviews.text: Been using Duck for years and the price for quality is well worth it. I have used this wrap for moving, packaging items for sale, storing sensitive items etc. It just works, i have never had a roll with damaged bubbles and it is just so easy to work with. I suggest using scissors or razor knife when cutting for a clean straight edge. It doesn't tear well at all which is a good thing because it can be stretched and keeps it structure and integrity. Pros: Length, quality build, functionality Cons: None
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I still can’t believe how great this bubble wrap is. It’s been a great asset to my small business. It doesn’t take up much space, either. I bought the bulk pack, and have been very pleased with the quality and how it protects my customers packages. I paid for piece of mind and it was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: H. Alan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: I just started to use the bubble wrap as I'm moving and needed it to pad boxes, artwork, etc. The quality of the bubble wrap is horrible ! There are spaces on the roll where there are no bubbles, just plastic. Will never buy again from this company. Flimsy - my items feel unprotected. I went out and bought different bubble wrap to use instead.
customer_reviews.author: red mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Bubbles were 1/2 if that much FULL.
customer_reviews.text: Duck products are normally really good ! But not this time the roll of bubble wrap was like used the bubbles were only 1/2 full of that. And I would return but I am packing to move. I had to use double the amount of wrap per item.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Not perforated!
customer_reviews.text: Bubble wrap itself is fine but the roll is NOT perforated every 12 inches as advertised. Deliver what you advertise!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The bubble wrap is very flimsy and thing. We have to use a lot more to protect items than other brands. Very dissatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Mike and Chele

customer_reviews.title: Good, but there is better for similar price.
customer_reviews.text: This bubble wrap is thin. Minimal air cushion. Use this wrap between inexpensive plates or bowls to provide minimal cushioning so there is no clatter. I would not use this wrap as additional cushion to minimize movement within a box.
customer_reviews.author: Tull1

customer_reviews.title: Know your thickness levels!
customer_reviews.text: Look very carefully at the thickness levels you’re purchasing. This was so very thin, I have to double up to make sure nothing breaks. Not sure if this thin of a wrap works on breakables...it’s more for scratch prevention, not break prevention.
customer_reviews.author: seana

customer_reviews.title: Huge Roll with Small Bubbles
customer_reviews.text: This roll is humongous and was primarily purchased for packing items in a long distance move. The item advertises that the sheets are perforated and they are so that makes it convenient. The sheets don't always rip easily so scissors are sometimes needed and you may need more for the amount that are pre-cut. The bubbles are small so you'll need multiple layers for very fragile items. Overall, this roll covered a move of one bedroom apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Viola

customer_reviews.title: Good packing material!
customer_reviews.text: We have bought several of these rolls of bubble wrap and they have worked out well! Our small business is shipping delicate items in the mail and with adequate wrapping our shipments are making it intact. The perforations have all torn cleanly and easily and the bubbles are not so thin that they break with normal handling. It is a good price and we will continue to purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: I know that there are places to buy it for cheaper and in larger quantities in different brands but I always come back to this one because its so easy to tear each sheet and I've had some that ...
customer_reviews.text: I come back to Amazon to purchase this over and over again because I use it so much when I am shipping items through my Etsy store. I know that there are places to buy it for cheaper and in larger quantities in different brands but I always come back to this one because its so easy to tear each sheet and I've had some that were seriously difficult. I will be back again next month for more haha.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina McGehee

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsier than I had expected, but worked as needed anyway
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to insulate window air conditioners for the winter. The bubble wrap ripped more easily than other brands I had used before, but the windows' gaps are tightly sealed, and it's warm and cozy inside. Considering the reasonable price, I'd probably buy it again for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Linda NYC

customer_reviews.title: Eh, could be better for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Love that it comes in perforated sheets you can tear. It is a little thin however and got the daylights scared out of me when wrapping dishes and the bubbles popped with very little pressure. I think it’ll do the job, but it’s quite thin so don’t expect professional grade bubble wrap. I’d say it’s in the medium thickness category.
customer_reviews.author: Dezi

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, but Smells like Cigarettes!
customer_reviews.text: The good: It's name-brand and doesn't pop easily. Never had a problem with Duck/BubbleWrap before. The Bad: I don't know where this was stored but it stinks of cigarette smoke! It has permeated the entire roll and with each section I rip off I can smell more smoke. It's a shame, I'll now have to air out all of my packed materials. Also, I try and save as much as possible for friends or future needs, I will have to throw all of this away it smells so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Kercheval

customer_reviews.title: Working great for our move
customer_reviews.text: I think I am on my 3 roll and it has been working great as we prepare for our move next month. My wife is very cautious and makes sure everything is protected as best as she can. Tears I believe every foot with no effort at all and makes is much faster when packing smaller items. These are small bubbles but that is what we wanted and the bonus is you get a nice box to use from the one that they ship it in lol ! Take Care GrandpaJake
customer_reviews.author: 🎄 GrandpaJake 🎄

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, your standard bubble wrap, a bit narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, a bit more narrow than I expected it to be.I bought it specifically to roll out so my kid could have fun popping it. Bubbles aren't as firm as I would have expected them to be. Some of it came with wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Miks

customer_reviews.title: This bubble wrap is super cheap so it seemed like a great value
customer_reviews.text: This bubble wrap is super cheap so it seemed like a great value. However, the bubbles pop veeeeery easily. I would recommend buying bubble wrap with bigger bubbles or maybe a slightly higher quality if you want to protect your stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sovertop Tith

customer_reviews.title: Light weight bubble wrap
customer_reviews.text: I specifically ordered Duck Brand but am not sure if the bubble wrap I received is Duck Brand as there is no identifying wrap or label on the rolls, as pictured on the Amazon site. The wrap I received is light weight and the perforations are a little difficult to see. When located, the perforations do work for tearing into smaller sheets. This product is not quite the quality I was expecting. I am using it to pick for a move and will double up as needed for fragile items.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Pops too easily
customer_reviews.text: It's okay for bubble wrap at a good price. However, as another reviewer mentioned, the bubbles pop way too easily. When wrapping or picking up an item post wrap, the bubbles pop negating the wrapping. I don't know if this is how all bubble wrap is now, but the last time I moved this wasn't a problem. Unfortunately, I can't remember the brand of that wrap. I suppose this bubble wrap is good for popping but not for protecting.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B. Sessa

customer_reviews.title: You definitely get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.text: Another case where a name brand beats the off brands! I have always purchased cheaper off brands for packing when moving. I figured they were "good enough". Well, I figured wrong. This is very easy to see where to tear at 12". No fighting the perforated lines either. It tears smoothly and easily. I have always used the larger bubbles, but these smaller bubbles are much better for packing glassware, dishes and other very fragile things because you can easily fold the wrap tightly and securely around the item. Moving and packing is stressful enough. Anything that makes it easier is well worth the extra few cents, like this wrap.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynnTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Not properly perforated
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that that there is what appears to be perforations every 12 inches, as indicated. However, they do not tear at these places. You have to use scissors to cut it to size. It seems like it wasn't worth it to buy the bubble wrap with perforations if I had to do it myself anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so reviewing this seems like you would either give a one or five star ...
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to screw up bubble wrap, so reviewing this seems like you would either give a one or five star rating. I'm happy to say that this bubble wrap is good quality and protected what I needed it to with a couple layers. I was moving across the country and wrapped up some picture frames and other fragile ceramic items with this product. I did a few layers for each item and nothing broke during the move. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Ullom

customer_reviews.title: It's a wrap!
customer_reviews.text: Bubble wrap, that is. And a LOT of it. At a pretty good price too. Useful to have laying around in you're constantly finding yourself in need of packing material (or stress relief). All in all, it does its job, and it does it well. My only gripes with it are that the perforations come every 12in, which I actually found a little too far apart while I was packing up a bunch of items to ship out this past week; and that the cardboard tube in the center is loose enough that it has a tendency to keep falling out of the roll. That said, neither of these are big enough issues to warrant docking any stars.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Wang

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I run a business at home and use a lot of bubble wrap. I expected a higher quality wrap because of the brand. Lowe's makes a better quality wrap if you can get over it being green in color.
customer_reviews.author: tonnya151

customer_reviews.title: I heart this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't move without this stuff! I love how easily the perforation comes apart, and how it molds to the item being wrapped! It lasts for a long time. I packed up my entire apartment: dishes, collectables, electronics, and breakable sundries.... 4 rolls! Best part is that I have some to spare! I am a very happy mover!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: While it's more expensive than the generic stuff, its overall superiority easily justifies the difference. I used various brands during two recent moves. This one was easily the best.
customer_reviews.author: Bob A.

customer_reviews.title: By defination, it is bubble wrap... that's best thing I can say about it.
customer_reviews.text: The bubble wrap was delivered on time, looked good, but most of the bubbles doesn't hold air.... the lightest pressure on them and they go flat immediately! I couldn't even make a "Pop" sound. I'm not impressed at all. I bought some at a local store for about the same price and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Miller

customer_reviews.title: Just okay; expected more.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get American Bubble Boy brand in time, so ordered this. I thought being a known brand name would ensure a quality product. Unfortunately it is just okay. If just okay is good enough for you, then by all means buy it. American Bubble Boy is better.
customer_reviews.author: inhighspeed

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally fragile bubbles
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several rolls of small-bubble bubble wrap in recent years, in various brands. The thing that stood out about Duck Brand was that the bubbles were exceptionally fragile. They popped with very little effort as I was packing up some ceramic pieces. I'm accustomed to needing to apply deliberate force to pop bubbles, but with this brand I needed to handle it carefully while wrapping in order to AVOID popping the bubbles. I won't buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: DogLover

customer_reviews.title: Bubbles pop very easily
customer_reviews.text: This wrap is very soft but, just trying to wrap things caused repeated popping of the bubbles. I don't know if it matters since I wrapped with multiple layers, but I am a bit concerned. The bubble wrap I had from another order was much tougher and yet soft enough to wrap anything. This wrap is quite thin. I like it, but I prefer something a little more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: mocean

customer_reviews.title: Soft, flexible but not strong.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this before and I don't remember it being so fragile. If you are packing small delicate items I can see using this product. But I was sending vintage cameras and it easily tore when wrapping the cameras. I think I'll try another brand next time. I tossed the huge box they were packed in or I would return two rolls.
customer_reviews.author: Zigfried

customer_reviews.title: IT'S ABOUT WHAT YOU'D EXPECT
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's bubble wrap in perforated tear-off sheets. It's a bit thin, not just the bubbles, but the thickness of the plastic as well, but as long as you are careful wrapping the breakables they should be fine. But it's certainly not as hard wearing as the bubble wrap of ten years ago. But then, what was? It's a good value for how much you get. We wrapped most of our breakable chachkies for our move with less than two rolls.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. cardoza

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This bubble wrap is hard to cut off, but it doesn’t affect anything. The value of this bubble wrap I think is a little bit overpriced, but this is the cheapest one I can found on Amazon. So I think is worth to buy it compare to others from Amazon .
customer_reviews.author: pie

customer_reviews.title: Fully inflated bubbles, well-perforated
customer_reviews.text: I'd bought this product several times recently but ran out last month; I grabbed a different brand bubble wrap in town at the big box store thinking "It's bubble wrap, how different can it be?". Well, evidently not all bubble wrap is made equal. This one has nicely inflated bubbles (which is the whole point of buying it) plus it is nicely perforated; no struggling to tear like with the other product (which also was perforated). I actually reopened some of our boxes to rewrap our most fragile stuff with this one.
customer_reviews.author: LeonaG

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I used this bubble wrap on glass and other fragile items when I moved to my new home. Worked perfectly and great quality! I also have an elderly aunt that is blind and enjoys pooping the bubble wrap. Definitely worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jaz Merlo

customer_reviews.title: Great value for my move
customer_reviews.text: This bubble pack material was perfect for packing anything I had...and it tore easily along the perforations, unlike some that I had purchased at a local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - large amount!
customer_reviews.text: Who would think there would be better than average bubble wrap? I have bought bubble wrap that is very expensive for the amount you can purchase. This came in a large box and I felt a very good amount for the $$. It also has little places where the wrap can tear down (if you hold it up you will see a slightly darker line from top to bottom - discovered while trying to tear.
customer_reviews.author: sharon woodfin

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I run an eBay shop and I also sell on Amazon through their FBA program, so I use a lot of bubble wrap. These 150 Foot roll lasts me a while. This roll is my go to for bubble wrap. Duck is easy to rip without tearing into the piece next to it. It does its job and is cost efficient. 5 Stars as long as the price doesn't go up. Do yourself a favor and pay up for this instead of purchasing no-name brands.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

product_meta.title: Duck Brand Bubble Wrap Roll, Original Bubble Cushioning, 12" x 150', Perforated Every 12" (284054)
product_meta.description: Size:12 in. x 150 ft.The key to your items arriving in one piece? Duck Brand Original Bubble Wrap Cushioning - it keeps objects protected whether they're in the mail or on the move. Featuring Air Lock Technology that maintains consistent cushioning and a long lasting protection, this Bubble wrap easily conforms around your most treasured items and gifts for light-as-air cushioning. Plus it fills up empty voids when you're packing boxes so your valuables stay put during mailing, shipping, moving and storage.
feature_bullets: Original Bubble Wrap cushioning roll features small size bubbles
Conforms easily around delicate and valuable items during moving, mailing and storage
Features Air Lock Technology nylon barrier seal to hold air longer and protect items better
Perforated every 12 inches to easily tear off the roll

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,305 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
